intro: Paeonia linyanshanii subsp. taibaishanica, commonly known as the Taibaishan peony, is a rare and ornamental species native to China. It belongs to the芍药属 (Paeonia) family, which includes various peony species known for their showy flowers and medicinal properties. This subspecies is characterized by its large, showy blooms that typically range in color from pink to red, with a distinctive fragrance. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
